alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 19 at 1:19AM EST until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. Lower Roanoke River At Roanoke Rapids affecting Northampton and Halifax Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River at Smithfield. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 AM EST Friday was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 15.9 feet Sunday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 10/13/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Tue Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 15.0 Fri 12 am ES 15.4 15.8 15.9 15.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 900 AM EST.early this morning at 230 AM EST.
